00058 # Load Resource
00059 import common_rc
00060 # When using loadUiType(), the generated (and executed) code will try to import
00061 # common_rc and it will crash if we don't ensure it's available in PYTHONPATH
00062 # so by no we have to add Koo/Common to sys.path
00063 sys.path.append( os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__)) )

00065 ## @brief Returns a dictionary with all the attributes found in a XML with their 
00066 # name as key and the corresponding value.
00067 def nodeAttributes(node):
00068    result = {}
00069    attrs = node.attributes
00070    if attrs is None:
00071         return {}
00072    for i in range(attrs.length):
00073         result[attrs.item(i).localName] = attrs.item(i).nodeValue
00074    return result

00076 (SelectionDialogUi, SelectionDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('win_selection.ui') )
00077 
00078 ## @brief The SelectionDialog class shows a dialog prompting the user to choose
00079 # among a list of items.
00080 #
00081 # The selected value is stored in the 'result' property.
00082 # @see selection()
00083 class SelectionDialog(QDialog, SelectionDialogUi):      
00084         def __init__(self, title, values, parent=None):
00085                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00086                 SelectionDialogUi.__init__(self)
00087                 self.setupUi( self )
00088 
00089                 if title:
00090                         self.uiTitle.setText( title )
00091                 for x in values.keys():
00092                         item = QListWidgetItem()
00093                         item.setText(x)
00094                         item.value = values[x]
00095                         self.uiList.addItem( item )
00096                 self.connect( self.pushAccept, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.selected )
00097 
00098         def selected(self):
00099                 self.result = ""
00100                 item = self.uiList.currentItem()
00101                 self.result = ( unicode(item.text()), item.value )
00102                 self.accept()
00103 
00104 ## @brief Shows the SelectionDialog
00105 #
00106 # It returns the selected item or False if none was selected.
00107 #
00108 # No dialog will be shown if the dictionary of values is empty. If alwaysask 
00109 # is False (the default) no dialog is shown and the only element is returned
00110 # as selected.
00111 def selection(title, values, alwaysask=False):
00112         if len(values) == 0:
00113                 return None
00114         elif len(values)==1 and (not alwaysask):
00115                 key = values.keys()[0]
00116                 return (key, values[key])
00117         s = SelectionDialog(title, values)
00118         if s.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00119                 return s.result
00120         else:
00121                 return False
00122

00126 ## @brief The TipOfTheDayDialog class shows a dialog with a Tip of the day
00127 # TODO: Use KTipDialog when we start using KDE libs
00128 class TipOfTheDayDialog( QDialog, TipOfTheDayDialogUi ):
00129         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00130                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00131                 TipOfTheDayDialogUi.__init__(self)
00132                 self.setupUi( self )
00133 
00134                 try:
00135                         self.number = int( Settings.value('tip.position') )
00136                 except:
00137                         self.number = 0
00138         
00139                 self.connect( self.pushNext, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.nextTip )
00140                 self.connect( self.pushPrevious, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.previousTip )
00141                 self.connect( self.pushClose, SIGNAL('clicked()'), self.closeTip )
00142                 self.uiShowNextTime.setChecked( Settings.value('tip.autostart') )
00143                 self.showTip()
00144         
00145         def showTip(self):
00146                 tips = file(searchFile('kootips.txt')).read().split('---')
00147                 tip = tips[self.number % len(tips)]
00148                 del tips
00149                 self.uiTip.setText(tip)
00150 
00151         def nextTip(self):
00152                 self.number+=1
00153                 self.showTip()
00154 
00155         def previousTip(self):
00156                 if self.number>0:
00157                         self.number -= 1
00158                 self.showTip()
00159 
00160         def closeTip(self):
00161                 Settings.setValue( 'tip.autostart', self.uiShowNextTime.isChecked() )
00162                 Settings.setValue( 'tip.position', self.number+1 )
00163                 Settings.saveToFile()
00164                 self.close()

00166 ## @brief Shows a warning dialog. Function used by the notifier in the Koo application.
00167 def warning(title, message):
00168         QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.ArrowCursor )
00169         QMessageBox.warning(None, title, message)
00170         QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00171 
00172 ## @brief The ConcurrencyErrorDialog class provices a Dialog used when a 
00173 # concurrency error is received from the server.
00174 class ConcurrencyErrorDialog(QMessageBox):
00175         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00176                 QMessageBox.__init__(self, parent)      
00177                 self.setIcon( QMessageBox.Warning )
00178                 self.setWindowTitle( _('Concurrency warning') )
00179                 self.setText( _('<b>Write concurrency warning:</b><br/>This document has been modified while you were editing it.') )
00180                 self.addButton( _('Save anyway'), QMessageBox.AcceptRole )
00181                 self.addButton( _('Compare'), QMessageBox.ActionRole )
00182                 self.addButton( _('Do not save'), QMessageBox.RejectRole )
00183         
00184 ## @brief Shows the ConcurrencyErrorDialog. Function used by the notifier in the Koo application.
00185 def concurrencyError(model, id, context):
00186         QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.ArrowCursor )
00187         dialog = ConcurrencyErrorDialog()
00188         result = dialog.exec_()
00189         QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00190         if result == 0:
00191                 return True
00192         if result == 1:
00193                 Api.instance.createWindow( False, model, id, context=context )
00194 
00195         return False

00197 (ErrorDialogUi, ErrorDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('error.ui') )
00198 
00199 ## @brief The ErrorDialog class shows the error dialog used everywhere in Koo.
00200 #
00201 # The dialog shows two tabs. One with a short description of the problem and the
00202 # second one with the details, usually a backtrace.
00203 #
00204 # @see error()
00205 class ErrorDialog( QDialog, ErrorDialogUi ):
00206         def __init__(self, title, message, details='', parent=None):
00207                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00208                 ErrorDialogUi.__init__(self)
00209                 self.setupUi( self )
00210 
00211                 self.uiDetails.setText( details )
00212                 self.uiErrorInfo.setText( message )
00213                 self.uiErrorTitle.setText( title )
00214         
00215         def done(self, r):
00216                 QDialog.done(self, r)
00217 
00218 
00219 ## @brief Shows the ErrorDialog. Function used by the notifier in the Koo application.
00220 def error(title, message, details=''):
00221         Debug.error( 'MSG %s: %s' % (unicode(message), unicode(details)) )
00222         QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.ArrowCursor )
00223         dialog = ErrorDialog( unicode(title), unicode(message), unicode(details) )
00224         dialog.exec_()
00225         QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()

00227 (ProgressDialogUi, ProgressDialogBase) = loadUiType( uiPath('progress.ui') )
00228                 
00229 ## @brief The ProgressDialog class shows a progress bar moving left and right until you stop it.
00230 #
00231 # To use it:
00232 # 1) Create a dialog (eg. dlg = ProgressDialog(self))
00233 # 2) Call the start function (eg. dlg.start() )
00234 # 3) Call the stop function when the operation has finished (eg. dlg.stop() )
00235 # Take into account that the dialog will only show after a couple of seconds. This way, it
00236 # only appears on long running tasks.
00237 class ProgressDialog(QDialog, ProgressDialogUi):
00238         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00239                 QDialog.__init__(self, parent)
00240                 ProgressDialogUi.__init__(self)
00241                 self.setupUi( self )
00242                 self.progressBar.setMinimum( 0 )
00243                 self.progressBar.setMaximum( 0 )
00244                 
00245         def start(self):
00246                 self.timer = QTimer()
00247                 self.connect( self.timer, SIGNAL('timeout()'), self.timeout )
00248                 self.timer.start( 2000 )
00249 
00250         def timeout(self):
00251                 self.timer.stop()
00252                 self.show()
00253                 
00254         def stop(self):
00255                 self.timer.stop()
00256                 self.accept()
00257 
00258 ## @brief Opens the given file with system's default application.
00259 def openFile( fileName ):
00260         if os.name == 'nt':
00261                 os.startfile(fileName)
00262         elif os.uname()[0] == 'Darwin':
00263                 os.system('/usr/bin/open -a Preview %s' % fileName)
00264         else:
00265                 os.spawnlp(os.P_NOWAIT, 'xdg-open', 'xdg-open', fileName)
00266 
00267 ## @brief Converts GTK accelerators to Qt ones.
00268 # GTK uses underscore as accelerator in labels and buttons whereas Qt uses
00269 # ampersand. This function will convert a text prepared for a GTK label into
00270 # a valid Qt one.
00271 def normalizeLabel( text ):
00272         res = ''
00273         underscore = False
00274         for x in text:
00275                 if x == '_':
00276                         if underscore:
00277                                 res += '_'
00278                                 underscore = False
00279                         else:
00280                                 underscore = True
00281                 else:
00282                         if underscore:
00283                                 res += '&'
00284                                 underscore = False
00285                         if x == '&':
00286                                 res += '&&'
00287                         else:
00288                                 res += x
00289         return res

00291 
00292 ## @brief This function converts a string into a boolean.
00293 # 
00294 # Given that OpenERP has changed the way it handles booleans in view definitions
00295 # it's a bit complicated to properly evaluate it. At first only "1" and "0" were
00296 # used, for example.
00297 def stringToBool(text):
00298         if isinstance(text, str) or isinstance(text, unicode):
00299                 text = text.strip()
00300                 if text.lower() == 'true' or text == '1':
00301                         return True
00302                 if text.lower() == 'false' or text == '0':
00303                         return False
00304         return bool(text)
